trans-unit.source: Contains information about a WMI method.
Gets the input parameters to the method.
Each parameter is described as a property in the object.

If a parameter is both in and out, it appears in both the <xref href="System.Management.MethodData.InParameters"></xref> and <xref href="System.Management.MethodData.OutParameters"></xref> properties.
Each parameter in the object should have an ID qualifier, identifying the order of the parameters in the method call.
Property Value
A <xref:System.Management.ManagementBaseObject> containing all the input parameters to the method.
.NET Framework Security
Full trust for the immediate caller.
This member cannot be used by partially trusted code.
For more information, see [Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code](~/docs/framework/misc/using-libraries-from-partially-trusted-code.md).
Returns a <xref href="System.Management.ManagementBaseObject"></xref> containing the input parameters to the method.
Gets the name of the method.
Property Value
The name of the method.
.NET Framework Security
Full trust for the immediate caller.
This member cannot be used by partially trusted code.
For more information, see [Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code](~/docs/framework/misc/using-libraries-from-partially-trusted-code.md).
Returns a <xref href="System.String"></xref> value containing the name of the method.
Gets the name of the management class in which the method was first introduced in the class inheritance hierarchy.
Property Value
A string representing the originating management class name.
.NET Framework Security
Full trust for the immediate caller.
This member cannot be used by partially trusted code.
For more information, see [Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code](~/docs/framework/misc/using-libraries-from-partially-trusted-code.md).
Returns a <xref href="System.String"></xref> value containing the name of the class in which the method was first introduced in the class inheritance hierarchy.
Gets the output parameters to the method.
Each parameter is described as a property in the object.

If a parameter is both in and out, it will appear in both the <xref href="System.Management.MethodData.InParameters"></xref> and <xref href="System.Management.MethodData.OutParameters"></xref> properties.
Each parameter in this object should have an ID qualifier to identify the order of the parameters in the method call.

The **ReturnValue** property is a special property of the <xref:System.Management.ManagementBaseObject> returned by the <xref:System.Management.MethodData.OutParameters%2A> property and holds the return value of the method.
Property Value
A <xref:System.Management.ManagementBaseObject> containing all the output parameters to the method.
.NET Framework Security
Full trust for the immediate caller.
This member cannot be used by partially trusted code.
For more information, see [Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code](~/docs/framework/misc/using-libraries-from-partially-trusted-code.md).
Returns a <xref href="System.Management.ManagementBaseObject"></xref> containing the output parameters for the method.
Gets a collection of qualifiers defined in the method.
Each element is of type <xref href="System.Management.QualifierData"></xref> and contains information such as the *qualifier* name, value, and *flavor*.
Property Value
A <xref:System.Management.QualifierDataCollection> containing the qualifiers for this method.
.NET Framework Security
Full trust for the immediate caller.
This member cannot be used by partially trusted code.
For more information, see [Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code](~/docs/framework/misc/using-libraries-from-partially-trusted-code.md).
Returns a <xref href="System.Management.QualifierDataCollection"></xref> containing the qualifiers for the method.
